attributes.action: Keep indoor gyms open during the second national lockdown
attributes.additional_details:
Health and fitness is vitally important for physical and mental health, particularly now we are into winter. 

The weather and fewer daylight hours makes makes it increasingly difficult to exercise outdoors.

Gyms have been open safely for months, with users respecting the rules and social distancing
attributes.background:
Keep indoor gyms open. Gyms have been open safely for months with limited numbers, social distancing and regular and thorough cleaning.

If mitigation measures were required, maximum numbers could be limited further to lower the risk as much as possible, while allowing people to stay fit.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
